comments.name: apezuela

comments.html:
Ivan is close to correct. FPGAs have a huge amount of flexibility at the logical gate level, but you pay for that in terms of price/poerformance.
Programmable ASICs support certain types of primitives designed for dealing with packet forwarding operations.

Take a look at http://techfieldday.com/appearance/cisco-enterprise-switching-presents-at-tech-field-day-extra-at-cisco-live-berlin/ and http://techfieldday.com/video/programmable-asics-for-cisco-catalyst-switches-with-muhammad-imam/ for more info.
